question: Which country is the birthplace of the famous comic strip "The Adventure of Tintin"?
explanation: The Adventures of Tintin is a series of 24 albums created by Belgian cartoonist Georges Remi, who wrote the series under the pen name Herge. The first series appeared in French on a Belgian newspaper Belgium is also the birthplace of another famous comic book series "The Smurfs" by Pierre Culliford.
